intro: Pterocymbium nicobaricum, commonly known as the Nicobar star-fruit, is a tropical plant native to the Andaman and Nicobar Islands. It is characterized by its distinctive star-shaped fruits, which are typically yellow or orange when mature. The plant belongs to the family Cucurbitaceae, commonly known as the gourd family. Its leaves are broad and heart-shaped, while its vines can grow quite long. The fruit is edible, though it is less commonly cultivated compared to other members of its family.
